<a id="Vector3i"></a>

# Vector3i

A 3D vector using integer coordinates.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A 3-element structure that can be used to represent 3D grid coordinates or any other triplet of integers.

It uses integer coordinates and is therefore preferable to [Vector3](Vector3.md) when exact precision is required. Note that the values are limited to 32 bits, and unlike [Vector3](Vector3.md) this cannot be configured with an engine build option. Use [int](int.md) or [PackedInt64Array](PackedInt64Array.md) if 64-bit values are needed.

\ **Note:** In a boolean context, a Vector3i will evaluate to ``false`` if it's equal to ``Vector3i(0, 0, 0)``. Otherwise, a Vector3i will always evaluate to ``true``.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Math documentation index](../tutorials/math/index.md)

- [3Blue1Brown Essence of Linear Algebra](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHQObOWTQDPD3MizzM2xVFitgF8hE_ab)

<a id="Vector3i_constant_AXIS_X"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Axis](Vector3i.md#enum_Vector3i_Axis) **AXIS_X** = `0`

Enumerated value for the X axis. Returned by [max_axis_index()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_max_axis_index) and [min_axis_index()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_min_axis_index).<a id="Vector3i_constant_AXIS_Y"></a>

[Axis](Vector3i.md#enum_Vector3i_Axis) **AXIS_Z** = `2`

Enumerated value for the Z axis. Returned by [max_axis_index()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_max_axis_index) and [min_axis_index()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_min_axis_index).<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

## Constants

<a id="Vector3i_constant_ZERO"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**ZERO** = `Vector3i(0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_ZERO)

Zero vector, a vector with all components set to ``0``.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_ONE"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**ONE** = `Vector3i(1, 1, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_ONE)

One vector, a vector with all components set to ``1``.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_MIN"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**MIN** = `Vector3i(-2147483648, -2147483648, -2147483648)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_MIN)

Min vector, a vector with all components equal to ``INT32_MIN``. Can be used as a negative integer equivalent of [Vector3.INF](Vector3.md#Vector3_constant_INF).

<a id="Vector3i_constant_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**MAX** = `Vector3i(2147483647, 2147483647, 2147483647)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_MAX)

Max vector, a vector with all components equal to ``INT32_MAX``. Can be used as an integer equivalent of [Vector3.INF](Vector3.md#Vector3_constant_INF).

<a id="Vector3i_constant_LEFT"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**LEFT** = `Vector3i(-1, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_LEFT)

Left unit vector. Represents the local direction of left, and the global direction of west.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_RIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**RIGHT** = `Vector3i(1, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_RIGHT)

Right unit vector. Represents the local direction of right, and the global direction of east.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_UP"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**UP** = `Vector3i(0, 1, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_UP)

Up unit vector.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_DOWN"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**DOWN** = `Vector3i(0, -1, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_DOWN)

Down unit vector.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_FORWARD"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**FORWARD** = `Vector3i(0, 0, -1)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_FORWARD)

Forward unit vector. Represents the local direction of forward, and the global direction of north.

<a id="Vector3i_constant_BACK"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**BACK** = `Vector3i(0, 0, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constant_BACK)

Back unit vector. Represents the local direction of back, and the global direction of south.

<a id="Vector3i_property_x"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **x** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_property_x)

The vector's X component. Also accessible by using the index position ``[0]``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_property_y"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **y** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_property_y)

The vector's Y component. Also accessible by using the index position ``[1]``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_property_z"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **z** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_property_z)

The vector's Z component. Also accessible by using the index position ``[2]``.

## Constructor Descriptions

<a id="Vector3i_constructor_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **Vector3i**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_constructor_Vector3i)

Constructs a default-initialized **Vector3i** with all components set to ``0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **Vector3i**\ (\ from\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ )

Constructs a **Vector3i** as a copy of the given **Vector3i**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **Vector3i**\ (\ from\: [Vector3](Vector3.md)\ )

Constructs a new **Vector3i** from the given [Vector3](Vector3.md) by truncating components' fractional parts (rounding towards zero). For a different behavior consider passing the result of [Vector3.ceil()](Vector3.md#Vector3_method_ceil), [Vector3.floor()](Vector3.md#Vector3_method_floor) or [Vector3.round()](Vector3.md#Vector3_method_round) to this constructor instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **Vector3i**\ (\ x\: [int](int.md), y\: [int](int.md), z\: [int](int.md)\ )

Returns a **Vector3i** with the given components.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="Vector3i_method_abs"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **abs**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_abs)

Returns a new vector with all components in absolute values (i.e. positive).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_clamp"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **clamp**\ (\ min\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md), max\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_clamp)

Returns a new vector with all components clamped between the components of `min` and `max`, by running [@GlobalScope.clamp()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_clamp) on each component.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_clampi"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **clampi**\ (\ min\: [int](int.md), max\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_clampi)

Returns a new vector with all components clamped between `min` and `max`, by running [@GlobalScope.clamp()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_clamp) on each component.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_distance_squared_to"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **distance_squared_to**\ (\ to\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_distance_squared_to)

Returns the squared distance between this vector and `to`.

This method runs faster than [distance_to()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_distance_to), so prefer it if you need to compare vectors or need the squared distance for some formula.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_distance_to"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **distance_to**\ (\ to\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_distance_to)

Returns the distance between this vector and `to`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_length"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **length**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_length)

Returns the length (magnitude) of this vector.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_length_squared"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **length_squared**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_length_squared)

Returns the squared length (squared magnitude) of this vector.

This method runs faster than [length()](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_method_length), so prefer it if you need to compare vectors or need the squared distance for some formula.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_max"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **max**\ (\ with\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_max)

Returns the component-wise maximum of this and `with`, equivalent to ``Vector3i(maxi(x, with.x), maxi(y, with.y), maxi(z, with.z))``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_max_axis_index"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **max_axis_index**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_max_axis_index)

Returns the axis of the vector's highest value. See ``AXIS_*`` constants. If all components are equal, this method returns [AXIS_X](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_constant_AXIS_X).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_maxi"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **maxi**\ (\ with\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_maxi)

Returns the component-wise maximum of this and `with`, equivalent to ``Vector3i(maxi(x, with), maxi(y, with), maxi(z, with))``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_min"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **min**\ (\ with\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_min)

Returns the component-wise minimum of this and `with`, equivalent to ``Vector3i(mini(x, with.x), mini(y, with.y), mini(z, with.z))``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_min_axis_index"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **min_axis_index**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_min_axis_index)

Returns the axis of the vector's lowest value. See ``AXIS_*`` constants. If all components are equal, this method returns [AXIS_Z](Vector3i.md#Vector3i_constant_AXIS_Z).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_mini"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **mini**\ (\ with\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_mini)

Returns the component-wise minimum of this and `with`, equivalent to ``Vector3i(mini(x, with), mini(y, with), mini(z, with))``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_sign"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **sign**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_sign)

Returns a new vector with each component set to ``1`` if it's positive, ``-1`` if it's negative, and ``0`` if it's zero. The result is identical to calling [@GlobalScope.sign()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_sign) on each component.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_snapped"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **snapped**\ (\ step\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_snapped)

Returns a new vector with each component snapped to the closest multiple of the corresponding component in `step`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_method_snappedi"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **snappedi**\ (\ step\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_method_snappedi)

Returns a new vector with each component snapped to the closest multiple of `step`.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Operator Descriptions

<a id="Vector3i_operator_neq_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator !=**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_neq_Vector3i)

Returns ``true`` if the vectors are not equal.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_mod_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator %**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_mod_Vector3i)

Gets the remainder of each component of the **Vector3i** with the components of the given **Vector3i**. This operation uses truncated division, which is often not desired as it does not work well with negative numbers. Consider using [@GlobalScope.posmod()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_posmod) instead if you want to handle negative numbers.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, -20, 30) % Vector3i(7, 8, 9)) # Prints (3, -4, 3)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_mod_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator %**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_mod_int)

Gets the remainder of each component of the **Vector3i** with the given [int](int.md). This operation uses truncated division, which is often not desired as it does not work well with negative numbers. Consider using [@GlobalScope.posmod()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_posmod) instead if you want to handle negative numbers.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, -20, 30) % 7) # Prints (3, -6, 2)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_mul_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_mul_Vector3i)

Multiplies each component of the **Vector3i** by the components of the given **Vector3i**.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, 20, 30) * Vector3i(3, 4, 5)) # Prints (30, 80, 150)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_mul_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_mul_float)

Multiplies each component of the **Vector3i** by the given [float](float.md). Returns a [Vector3](Vector3.md).

```
    print(Vector3i(10, 15, 20) * 0.9) # Prints (9.0, 13.5, 18.0)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_mul_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_mul_int)

Multiplies each component of the **Vector3i** by the given [int](int.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_sum_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator +**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_sum_Vector3i)

Adds each component of the **Vector3i** by the components of the given **Vector3i**.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, 20, 30) + Vector3i(3, 4, 5)) # Prints (13, 24, 35)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_dif_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator -**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_dif_Vector3i)

Subtracts each component of the **Vector3i** by the components of the given **Vector3i**.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, 20, 30) - Vector3i(3, 4, 5)) # Prints (7, 16, 25)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_div_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_div_Vector3i)

Divides each component of the **Vector3i** by the components of the given **Vector3i**.

```
    print(Vector3i(10, 20, 30) / Vector3i(2, 5, 3)) # Prints (5, 4, 10)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_div_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_div_float)

Divides each component of the **Vector3i** by the given [float](float.md). Returns a [Vector3](Vector3.md).

```
    print(Vector3i(1, 2, 3) / 2.5) # Prints (0.4, 0.8, 1.2)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_div_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_div_int)

Divides each component of the **Vector3i** by the given [int](int.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_lt_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_lt_Vector3i)

Compares two **Vector3i** vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is less than the X value of the `right` vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, and then with the Z values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_lte_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;=**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_lte_Vector3i)

Compares two **Vector3i** vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is less than or equal to the X value of the `right` vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, and then with the Z values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_eq_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator ==**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_eq_Vector3i)

Returns ``true`` if the vectors are equal.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_gt_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_gt_Vector3i)

Compares two **Vector3i** vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is greater than the X value of the `right` vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, and then with the Z values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_gte_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;=**\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_gte_Vector3i)

Compares two **Vector3i** vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is greater than or equal to the X value of the `right` vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, and then with the Z values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_idx_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator []**\ (\ index\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_idx_int)

Access vector components using their `index`. ``v[0]`` is equivalent to ``v.x``, ``v[1]`` is equivalent to ``v.y``, and ``v[2]`` is equivalent to ``v.z``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_unplus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator unary+**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_unplus)

Returns the same value as if the ``+`` was not there. Unary ``+`` does nothing, but sometimes it can make your code more readable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Vector3i_operator_unminus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator unary-**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Vector3i_operator_unminus)

Returns the negative value of the **Vector3i**. This is the same as writing ``Vector3i(-v.x, -v.y, -v.z)``. This operation flips the direction of the vector while keeping the same magnitude.
